person.persName: Josiah Stoddard Johnston (Nephew of Confederal General Albert Sidney Johnston and son-in-law of KY Provisional Governor George Washington Johnson)

body.p: Born in New Orleans, Louisiana, son of John Harris Johnston and Eliza Ellen Davidson. John Harris Johnston was the brother of Confederate General Albert Sidney Johnston and Josiah Stoddard Johnston, U.S. senator for Louisiana from 1822 to 1833. Josiah Stoddard Johnston (born 1833) received his education at the Latin school of S.V. Womack, in Shelbyville, Kentucky, and at the Western Military Institute. Graduated from Yale University in 1853 and subsequently received a diploma from the Law School of the University of Louisville. Married Eliza Johnson, daughter of George Washington Johnson and Anna Eliza Viley, in 1854. Was a cotton planter in Arkansas from 1855 to 1859. Then he returned to Scott County, Kentucky, where he owned a farm. Joined the Confederate army in 1861. Served on the staff of General Bragg. Was later chief of staff to General John C. Breckinridge.
